conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations of particles A and B during their acceleration phases, we need to analyze their velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
Particle A accelerates from rest to a velocity of 2v0 between 0 and t0.
Particle B accelerates from rest to a velocity of v0 between 0 and 5t0.
Acceleration a_A is the slope of the velocity-time graph for A, calculated as a_A = (2v0 - 0) / (t0 - 0) = 2v0/t0.
Acceleration a_B is the slope of the velocity-time graph for B, calculated as a_B = (v0 - 0) / (5t0 - 0) = v0/5t0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations is calculated as (2v0/t0) / (v0/5t0).
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 10:1.
